Here's a question for a math student to solve related to the substitution ciphers:

Using a Caesar Cipher (shift of 3), encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" into a substitution cipher.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using a Caesar Cipher with a shift of 3, we will shift each letter in the message 3 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter goes beyond 'Z', it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet.

M -> P
A -> D
T -> W
H -> K
E -> H
M -> P
A -> D
T -> W
I -> L
C -> F
S -> V

So, the encrypted message is "PDWKHPDWLFV".
